Nidalee also has nerf up, so Lee has more of the spotlight.

And then you notice that they have Nautilus buffs, and Skarner buffs, and Xin Zhao buffs, and Volibear buffs, and Gragas buffs, and Zac buffs, and buffs to the tank jungle item, and... hey, wait a minute, DID RIOT ACTUALLY JUST BUFF THE WEAK JUNGLERS THIS TIME?!?!? 

TL;DR: Lee Sin felt Philanthropic and donated some of his strength to weak junglers by robbing it from the strong, he is a true robin hood and should be venerated forever onwarâ€” oh wait, he already is LOL.

Okay, I feel kind of stupid; I don't actually play Nautilus, and from what I understand, you max your W first (which seems to have gotten nerfed). I realize his E is now spammable, but I'm not really seeing how this is much of a buff overall; again, maybe I'm just being stupid, but would you mind explaining to me?

EDIT: So been reading around, apparently being reliant on your W is a bad thing for Nautilus but something he was sort of forced into because his E was inefficient, which it now is spammable? So overall buff, I suppose

Basically, the way that they changed his shield's scalings a few patches back, it is generally really weak to max it first (better as second right now) because it scales with max health and ramps up fine by buying items, but a lot weaker than it used to be when maxed early. E is about twice as spammable now and has more consistent damage output than his W (which doesn't give any damage once the shield breaks). So basically, yes, they made it so Nautilus has damage even once his shield breaks, just not as directly as everyone thought they would, and ultimately this will help out his early-mid game immensely by boosting his clear speed and DPS early while his shield is weak, where late game his shield scales hard enough to make him look to be a real powerhouse in team fights. He almost looks more like an AP bruiser in terms of damage than a pure tank except for his ridiculous CC output.

I play a lot of Naut, even when he was weak. He still has a fairly healthy clear, but he's weak to invades from stronger Junglers. His W was always the priority, and them adding scaling helps a lot late. I haven't seen the new buffs, but his E was still incredibly important. It generally lands multiple hits as someone tries to escape. Any Naut buff has me excited, personally.

I'm a little sad that Lee is left alone constantly. I don't want to see him made useless, because he's a lot of fun, but his power level is certainly a bit out of hand and the public outcry is, what you'd think to be, hard to ignore, but somehow he's left alone.

You also need to recognize the importance of the new tank jungle item. While the nerf does impact his early game (you might just use E at level 1 and get a good leash), the jungle item per second is doing AoE damage around you all the time. This damage will match and eventually succeed what your shield would have been doing, it's always up where your shield isn't. So early game aside, it's a good buff. It more or less weakens his laning, but you weren't doing lane Naut that much (sorry lane Nauts), but hey, you can use your E a ton (mana costs could get crazy though).

They will probably buff the level 1 damage but keep the level 5 down.
Level 1 that E costs a measly 50 mana. Lane Naut may yet live.

> [{quoted}](name=junglerboy16,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=mQyrKMqi,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-02-28T00:43:01.060+0000)
>**Nautilus buffs**

Naut's W is his bread and butter. The rest of his kit is fine, all that needs updating is his W.

They tuned back the damage on his W (down to 15/30/45/60/75 from 40/55/70/85/100) and made E's (Riptide) cooldown only 6/5.5/5/4.5/4 seconds from 10, meaning that he doesn't need his shield to deal consistent damage anymore, which is in fact a MASSIVE buff. They also reduced the E's mana cost to 40/50/60/70/80 from 60/70/80/90/100, which is also a massive early game buff, all for trading away some of the AP ratio (like nautilus ever builds AP anyway).

> all for trading away some of the AP ratio (like nautilus ever builds AP anyway).

AP ratio down from 0.5 to 0.3. As you will be able to spam E every 4 seconds instead of 10, you will be doing 0.75 AP ratio over 10 seconds (mathematically speaking), so it's a flat buff to his AP ratio.

BTW, Nautilus often builds Abyssal and sometimes Rod of Ages, so yep, he gets ~150 AP from items.
Wow, I forgot that, and in that case, this is *EVEN MORE OF A BUFF THAN I THOUGHT!*

it's a rather huge nerf to his man though, the manacosts over 10 sec went from 100 to 200, and you really notice. And it isn't even a buff to his early mana, as you now **NEED** to use you E for camps(or trades in lane) and can't rely on only your W.

Doesn't matter.  The biggest thing holding Tank junglers back is their complete inability to duel Lee Sin or succeed when he counterganks.  When they meet in the jungle, they'll die, even with buffs.  When Lee counterganks, it might as well be 2v1 in Lee's favor.

Do you realize how much Lee sin absolutely sucks right now? I have not seen a Lee do anything useful in a match in MONTHS. They always try to invade and start feeding me kills. As full tank Sion jungle.

Do you realize how retarded that argument is?  Or, to put it another way, are you dumb enough to commit logical fallacies without recognizing them?

Let's ignore the fact that nobody who is WAY BETTER THAN YOU, SCRUB, is picking Sion jungle over Lee Sin jungle.  Let's even ignore the statistics.  You would still be arguing based on your level 21 experience that Sion is stronger than Lee Sin.  That's completely idiotic.  GTFO.

I'm sorry, you are absolutely correct that I made a faulty argument, however your Ad Hominem counter logic is far more flawed in that you assume several very important things about me. You assume I have little experience, when I have been playing this game for well over a year and a half. You take the fact that I made a hyperbole about Lee's current balance as grounds to assault me personally. You also default to insulting me instead of backing up your argument in any sound way. You have to realize that Lee sin is in fact much weaker than you claim he is, from a statistical and experiential perspective. You also assume that because Sion jungle is not a popular pick, that I am a n00b because of my personal preference.

Don't try to use the words logic and fallacy when you cannot support your claims either, you have only succeeded in making us *both* look foolish.

It isn't an ad hominem.  For it to be an ad hominem, I'd have to substitute you being a moron in place of your argument, but a logical fallacy is not an argument at all.  I have no need to offer a rebuttal; my original argument still stands, and is supported by players far more skilled and knowledgeable than you or I.  Tanky junglers cannot duel Lee Sin in the jungle.  Lee Sin, played intelligently, should be able to consistently three buff any of them without reprisal.  If he can counterjungle them, he can ward their jungle, and if he can ward their jungle, he can countergank, where he will offer far more impact than the tank jungler.  Yes, those junglers bring CC to the table, but that, on ganks, largely helps keep the enemy from running away.  If the enemy has no desire to run away, what do you do when the CC ends and they have more damage than you?

I like tanky junglers, and would even argue they bring more to the table late game than Lee Sin does.  Lee can only ult, as good as that is.  Nautilus can grab, slow, ult, and generally be annoying throughout the whole fight.  Amumu played properly is game-changing late.  The problem is that they cannot make it to late game while still having any semblance of parity with the opposing jungler.
